snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo must convince the Legislature, the voters and even developers, some of whom are not particularly keen on investing in gambling upstate.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo, who is counting on passage of referendum allowing  full-scale casino gambling in New York to bring in jobs and tourism, must first try to convince the Legislature; lawmakers are split by regional rivalries and pressure from competing gambling interests, and state's voters are divided over issue as well.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and CHARLES V. BAGLI
byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and Charles V. Bagli from New York.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo must convince the Legislature, the voters and even developers, some of whom are not particularly keen on investing in gambling upstate.

headline.main: Success of Cuomo’s Plan for More Casinos Relies on His Power of Persuasion
headline.print_headline: Success of Cuomo’s Plan for More Casinos Relies on His Power of Persuasion
